clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Failure Self-care Mobile Application to Reduce Readmissions Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Heart Failure Self-care Mobile Application to Reduce Readmissions Trial

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a patient-centered comparative effectiveness feasibility pilot designed to examine an intervention to increase heart failure self-care and symptom recognition. The investigators will randomize 100 participants to receive either usual care at the time of discharge after heart failure admission or a smartphone application that enhances self-care.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of participants readmitted within 30 days
primary_outcome.description: 30-day readmission rate as determined by participant report or medical record query

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of participants readmitted within 90 days
primary_outcome.description: 90-day readmission rate as determined by participant report or medical record query

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of enrollment until the date of first documented admission or date of death from any cause, whichever comes first, assessed up to 90 days

primary_outcome.measure: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire at 30 days post enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life, subjective level of function

primary_outcome.measure: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire at 90 days post enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life, subjective level of function

arm_group.description: Consists of routine care at the time of hospital discharge, to be provided at the discretion of the clinicians caring for the participant.
Participants will be provided a special link to navigate to the online content and resources.

intervention.description: When the participant navigates to the program, s/he will follow the directions on how to use the program, sign the terms of agreement, put in a password and begin the welcome page. The participant will receive daily prompts to complete brief questionnaires and review specialized content.
Routine care at the time of hospital discharge, to be provided at the discretion of the clinicians caring for the participant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inpatient admission for acute decompensated heart failure
- Left ventricular systolic or diastolic heart failure
- Owns a smartphone with a data plan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hospice or life expectancy less than 6 months
- Palliative inotrope use
- Heart transplant listed, or status post transplant
- Ventricular assist devise present, or awaiting placement
- Not being discharged to home
- Unable to provide consent or comply with the intervention
- Current enrollment in a remote monitoring/ telehealth program
